p: By contrast, complete uptake of other routinely-recommended vaccines is much higher. In the most recent published estimates (2017), the percent of children 19–35 months old up-to-date (UTD) on other recommendations was: 83.2% for 4+ diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis vaccine doses, 92.7% for 3+ poliovirus vaccine doses, 91.5% for 1+ measles-mumps-rubella vaccine doses, 80.7% for 3+ Haemophilus influenza type B vaccine doses, 91.4% for 3+ Hepatitis B vaccine doses, 91.0% for 1+ varicella vaccine doses, and 82.4% for 4+ pneumococcal conjugate vaccine doses. [ 25] Moreover, the percentage UTD on all of these other recommendations (the “4:3:1:3:3:1:4” series) is 70.4%. [ 25]
